articles.headline: Republicans Block Impeachment Witnesses, Clearing Path for Trump Acquittal
articles.snippet: The narrow vote came after Republican senators said they did not need to hear more evidence, and pressed toward acquitting President Trump next week.
articles.abstract: The narrow vote came after Republican senators said they did not need to hear more evidence, and pressed toward acquitting President Trump next week.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate brought President Trump to the brink of acquittal on Friday of charges that he abused his power and obstructed Congress, as Republicans voted to block consideration of new witnesses and documents in his impeachment trial and shut down a final push by Democrats to bolster their case for the president’s removal.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Once Skeptical, Senate Republicans Are All In on Trump
articles.snippet: In pressing toward their preordained vote of acquittal, Senate Republicans made it clear they see their fortunes and futures intertwined with the president’s.
articles.abstract: In pressing toward their preordained vote of acquittal, Senate Republicans made it clear they see their fortunes and futures intertwined with the president’s.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s control of Senate Republicans is nearly complete.

articles.headline: Independent Voters See Economy Improving, a Potential Boon to Trump
articles.snippet: Consumer confidence has rebounded since recession warnings in the summer, particularly among voters who don’t lean toward either major party.
articles.abstract: Consumer confidence has rebounded since recession warnings in the summer, particularly among voters who don’t lean toward either major party.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans are feeling better about the economy, a trend that, if it continues, could bolster President Trump’s prospects for re-election in November.
articles.byline: By Ben Casselman and Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: What if Brexit Works?
articles.snippet: Britain is remaking itself again. The shape of its society and economy, and its place in the world, are very much up for grabs.
articles.abstract: Britain is remaking itself again. The shape of its society and economy, and its place in the world, are very much up for grabs.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain’s departure from the European Union on Friday drew a mournful reaction from many people who have long viewed Brexit as consigning their country, once the vanguard of Europe, to a future of economic mediocrity and geopolitical irrelevance.

articles.headline: ‘Angels’ in Hell: The Culture of Misogyny Inside Victoria’s Secret
articles.snippet: A Times investigation found widespread bullying and harassment of employees and models. The company expresses “regret.”
articles.abstract: A Times investigation found widespread bullying and harassment of employees and models. The company expresses “regret.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Victoria’s Secret defined femininity for millions of women. Its catalog and fashion shows were popular touchstones. For models, landing a spot as an “Angel” all but guaranteed international stardom.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg, Katherine Rosman, Sapna Maheshwari and James B. Stewart

articles.headline: Democratic Candidates Focus on All-Consuming Hunger to Unseat Trump
articles.snippet: With the Iowa caucuses set to kick off the primary season on Monday night, a Democratic race that began as a contest of ideas and ideologies has given way to a fixation on electability.
articles.abstract: With the Iowa caucuses set to kick off the primary season on Monday night, a Democratic race that began as a contest of ideas and ideologies has given way to a fixation on electability.
articles.lead_paragraph: SIOUX CITY, Iowa — After a long campaign of ideological clashes, policy debates and talk of a grand reckoning on the direction of the Democratic Party, the presidential primaries starting on Monday will be shaped by a less lofty but increasingly urgent matter: determining the best candidate to defeat an incumbent who has already proved to be a political survivor.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: As New Coronavirus Spread, China’s Old Habits Delayed Fight
articles.snippet: At critical turning points, Chinese authorities put secrecy and order ahead of openly confronting the growing crisis and risking public alarm or political embarrassment.
articles.abstract: At critical turning points, Chinese authorities put secrecy and order ahead of openly confronting the growing crisis and risking public alarm or political embarrassment.
articles.lead_paragraph: WUHAN, China — A mysterious illness had stricken seven patients at a hospital, and a doctor tried to warn his medical school classmates. “Quarantined in the emergency department,” the doctor, Li Wenliang, wrote in an online chat group on Dec. 30, referring to patients.
articles.byline: By Chris Buckley and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: While Stained in History, Trump Will Emerge From Trial Triumphant and Unshackled
articles.snippet: His acquittal in the Senate assured, the emboldened president will take his victory and grievance to the campaign trail, no longer worried about congressional constraint.
articles.abstract: His acquittal in the Senate assured, the emboldened president will take his victory and grievance to the campaign trail, no longer worried about congressional constraint.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Ralph Waldo Emerson seemed to foresee the lesson of the Senate impeachment trial of President Trump. “When you strike at a king,” Emerson famously said, “you must kill him.”

articles.headline: The Graying of the American Economy Is on Display in Iowa
articles.snippet: The state with a huge influence in picking presidential candidates doesn’t look much like the country as a whole. Except in the 60-plus crowd.
articles.abstract: The state with a huge influence in picking presidential candidates doesn’t look much like the country as a whole. Except in the 60-plus crowd.
articles.lead_paragraph: DUBUQUE, Iowa — Like most campaign events held in daylight hours during the week, Pete Buttigieg’s town hall in Dubuque recently was a sea of gray hair. When the time came for questions, many were from older people sharing personal stories of declining health, concerns about the cost of prescription drugs and questions about access to experimental treatment.
articles.byline: By Dionne Searcey, Alan Rappeport, Trip Gabriel and Robert Gebeloff

articles.headline: Coronavirus Pummels Wuhan, a City Short of Supplies and Overwhelmed
articles.snippet: It is nearly impossible to get the care they need to treat, or even diagnose, the coronavirus, say residents at the crisis’ center.
articles.abstract: It is nearly impossible to get the care they need to treat, or even diagnose, the coronavirus, say residents at the crisis’ center.
articles.lead_paragraph: WUHAN, China — Weak with fever, An Jianhua waited in line for seven hours outside the hospital in the cold, hoping to get tested for the new coronavirus, which doctors suspected she had contracted.

articles.headline: 2020 Super Bowl Commercials: Funeral for Mr. Peanut, Tears for Google
articles.snippet: Uplifting spots from major brands stayed away from divisive issues on TV’s biggest ad day. But Trump and Bloomberg crashed the party.
articles.abstract: Uplifting spots from major brands stayed away from divisive issues on TV’s biggest ad day. But Trump and Bloomberg crashed the party.
articles.lead_paragraph: An audience expected to be around 100 million. Big companies paying as much as $5.6 million for 30 seconds of advertising time. In addition to deciding the National Football League champion, the Super Bowl is the biggest event of the year for TV commercials.

articles.headline: Jeff Bezos Is Sued by His Girlfriend’s Brother
articles.snippet: Michael Sanchez says he was trying to protect his sister in a lawsuit complaint.
articles.abstract: Michael Sanchez says he was trying to protect his sister in a lawsuit complaint.
articles.lead_paragraph: The brother of Jeff Bezos’s girlfriend has filed a lawsuit accusing Mr. Bezos and his security consultant of defaming him in connection with a 2019 National Enquirer story revealing Mr. Bezos’s extramarital affair.
articles.byline: By Michael Rothfeld and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: New U.S. Travel Ban Shuts Door on Africa’s Biggest Economy, Nigeria
articles.snippet: The visa rules will affect nearly a quarter of the people on the African continent, including many hoping to join loved ones already  in the U.S.
articles.abstract: The visa rules will affect nearly a quarter of the people on the African continent, including many hoping to join loved ones already  in the U.S.
articles.lead_paragraph: The newlyweds had already been apart for half their yearlong marriage. Miriam Nwegbe was in Nigeria. Her husband was in Baltimore, and until she could join him, everything was on hold: finding a home together, trying for their first baby, becoming an American family.
articles.byline: By Ruth Maclean and Abdi Latif Dahir

articles.headline: A Top L Brands Executive Complained of Harassment. Then She Was Locked Out.
articles.snippet: Monica Mitro’s departure from the company that runs Victoria’s Secret is a case study in the wrong way to deal with allegations of misconduct.
articles.abstract: Monica Mitro’s departure from the company that runs Victoria’s Secret is a case study in the wrong way to deal with allegations of misconduct.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the more than two years since Harvey Weinstein was exposed as a sexual predator, the #MeToo movement has wrought a revolution in corporate governance — or so it would seem.

articles.headline: Democrats Had a 2020 Vision. This Isn’t Quite What They Expected.
articles.snippet: On the brink of actual voting, the party that preached of unity to defeat President Trump finds itself very divided.
articles.abstract: On the brink of actual voting, the party that preached of unity to defeat President Trump finds itself very divided.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWTON, Iowa — Democrats had a certain vision for this.

articles.headline: SARS Stung the Global Economy. The Coronavirus Is a Greater Menace.
articles.snippet: In the nearly 20 years since SARS, China’s importance in the global economy has grown exponentially.
articles.abstract: In the nearly 20 years since SARS, China’s importance in the global economy has grown exponentially.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2002, when a lethal, pneumonialike virus known as SARS emerged in China, the country’s factories were mostly churning out low-cost goods like T-shirts and sneakers for customers around the world.

articles.headline: OPEC Scrambles to React to Falling Oil Demand From China
articles.snippet: As the coronavirus hits China’s economy, threatening fuel demand, policymakers are weighing an emergency meeting to discuss cuts to crude output.
articles.abstract: As the coronavirus hits China’s economy, threatening fuel demand, policymakers are weighing an emergency meeting to discuss cuts to crude output.
articles.lead_paragraph: Officials of some of the world’s largest oil producers are scrambling to stem a sharp fall in prices over concerns that the growing coronavirus epidemic will reduce demand from China, the biggest importer.
